S.FORM: Misatapng to minanam, micomod to ko singsi, sowal sa ko hanciw, katomireng! mita’ong!""
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: Sata’angay hananay niyam ko ngiha’, Nga’ay ho singsi.""
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: Minanam i, pakafana’en no singsi kami to sa’osi no ’Amis.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the ’Amis language of numbers.

S.FORM: To’oren niyam ko singsi a misa’osi, miraradiw kami to no sa’osi a radiw.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: Adihayay ko ninanaman no mako a sowal no ’Amis.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many ’Amis languages.

S.FORM: Talakongkoan kako to romi’ami’ad, minanam kako to sowal no ’Amis to romi’ami’ad, o papatengilen ako ko ina to ninanaman ako.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the ’Amis language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: Ci Kacaw ko ngangan ako.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Kacaw。
My name is kacaw.

S.FORM: Ci Asing ko ngangan no wama ako.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Asing。
My dad’s name is Asing.

S.FORM: Ci Ipay ko ngangan no wina ako.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Ipay。
My mother’s name is Ipay.

S.FORM: Moetep ko mihecaan no mako anini a mihecaan.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: Cecayay ko kaka ako, ci Kolas cira, moerep ira ko cecay ko mihecaan nira anini a miheccaan.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Kolas，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is kolas, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: Mahecaday ko kongkoan niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: Maolahay kako ato kaka a miraradiw.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: Maolahay kako a midangoy, ano pahanhan i, mapolongay ko loma’ay niyam a midangoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: Maolahay kako a misawidang, nga’ay a malacafay kami a miraradiw ato midangoy.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: O wawa no ’Amis kako.
S.TRANSL: 我是阿美族的小孩。
I am an ’Amis child.

S.FORM: I Posong ko loma’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在台東市。
Our family lives in Posong.

S.FORM: Lalima ko paro no loma’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: Tatoloay kami a malikaka.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: Malacecayay ko aro’ kako ato wama, wina, kaka to fa’inayan ato kaka to fafahiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: ’akawangay ko wama ako, o kincac ko mira.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，他是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: Mangiliway ko wina ako, o ising ko mira.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，她是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: Misano’Amisan no wama kami i loma’.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the ’Amis language with us at home.

S.FORM: O kafaedetan a pahanahanan minokayay to kami talaniyaro’.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: Malacafayay kami malikaka tatolo a mitepa’ to takola’.
S.TRANSL: 我們兄姊三人會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: Maolahay kako to paro no loma’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: Malacafay kako ato wina a misalama anini.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: Salangdaw sanay ko kakarayan to romi’ad, cowa kasienaw cowa kafaedet ko romi’ad, saemelay ko fali.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: I rengorengosan kami a komaen to epang, tada diheko a mapacidal ko tireng.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: Herek no lahok, kahengang to ko kakarayan.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: Licayaen ako ko wina, mana kahengang sa ko kakarayan?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: Sowal sa ko wina, o aira ko faliyos tayni alatek.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: To dadaya, awaay ko o’ol i kakarayan, mahadakay to ko fo’is.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: Maminokay to kami.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: Toya pinokayan a lalan, pasifo’is kako a mitolon.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: Nanay ca to katayni ko faliyos, hay nga’ay mahadak ho kako a misalama.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，因為我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: I kaingid no kongkoan ko loma’ ako, rakat sanay kako a talakongkoan to romi’ami’ad, rakat sanay a minokay.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: Cowa kata’angay ko kongkoan niyam, ca ka hakowa ko mitiliday, mananamay to kami.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: Masa’opo i ontofa ko kaemangay a maemin, malacafay mimali, malacafay miholol.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: Mikihatiyaay ko singsi malacafay tamiyanan a misalama, mahecad to laloma’an ko kongkoan niyam.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: Miasikay to kami to pitilidan to romi’ami’ad.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: Roma a tamdaw misisit to palatawan, roma a tamadaw i, miasik to paenan.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: Miasik ho kami to roma a aasiken i kongkoan, ma’a’isal kami to tatayalen, makakomod kami to tatayalen, mansa masolimetay, makoracay ko kongkoan niyam to romi’ami’ad.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: Nacila, talaniyaro’ kako miliso’ ci akongan.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: Halafin to ca kasaso’araw kami, ma’ilol to kako cingraan.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: Ma’araw ni akong kako, pakaenen nira kako to kacawas, pananomen ho nira kako to ociya.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: Koesanay ko nipalomaan ni akong a kacawas, ’adetay.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: Maolahay kako to ociya ni akong, nga’ayay a nanomen.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: To kalahokan to i, malacafay kako aci fofo a mitangtang to sakalahok.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: Kadofah ko nitangtangan ni fofo a sakalahok, ira ko foting, koko’, ciyak ato comoli.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: Maharek malahok, tayra kami i padatengan midateng.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: Adihay ko nipafelian ni fofo takowanan a konga, tali ato lokiw, hawikiden no mako a panokay sa.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: Liyasen to ako cangra, liyaw a romi’ad tayra sato kako miliso’ cangraan, han ako.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: Keriden no singsi kami tayra i pinanowangan anini, misarayaray kami i ka’ayaw no fawahan a mi’aca to paya.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Micomod to i pinanowangan i, sowal sa ko singsi, “ora i ka’ayaway i, o ’aya’ayam, kaikor i, o ’one’oner, saniyaniyah han to ita a minengneng.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: Matalaway kako to ’oner, mansa cowa pinengneng kako to ’oner.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: Adihay ko ma’araway no mako a ’ayam, saefeefer sa cangra i kilakilangan, ma’araw haca ko ekong i ofang no kilang a mafoti’.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: Ira ko eco, efa ato lokedaw i pinanowangan, cowa ho paka’ara’araw kako tona pinanowang, paka’araw anini he:mek sa ko faloco’.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: Adihayay ko nisasingan no mako, sapipanengneng ci amaan ato ci inaan.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: Cila to a romi’ad hacafayen to no mako ci ama ato ci ina a tayra.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: Tona pa’aliwacan, tayra i Posong kako ato kaka to fafahiyan a miliso’ ci fakian.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: Nai Taypak kami mikalic to si’acefelay a tayra i Posong.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: Tahira i Posong, parakatay ci faki to paliding a militemoh tamiyanan.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: Cowa karaay ko loma’ ni faki to siyataw, ano pakapaliding soni tahiraay to.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: Ira ko ta’angayay a pahotingan i ngata no loma’ ni faki, mahakelong kami a citingsa tayra i pahotingan.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: I pahotingan, keriden ni faki kami pariri’ to siri ato mikalic to efa.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: Dadaya, mahakelong kami tayra i maci a malafi.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: Adihayay ko paliding i maci, mansa pakaotopay kami a tayra.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: Ya mamiliyas i, faheka matakaway ko otopay, saka mikalic to paso kami.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: Minokayay to kami tayra i Taypak no hatini, maxeraay hakiya ko otopay ni faki!
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有！
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: Kaemang ho kako i, itiraay i Farangaw ko loma’ niyam, mitilid to i, malinahay tayra i Taypak, itira sanay to ko ’orip i tokay.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在馬蘭，上學以後，就搬到了台北，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Farangaw. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: Mitilid to i Tayhak, minanam kako to serangawan no Yincomin, cipinangay to a mafana’ to makahirahiraay a serangawan no Yincominco i Taywan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: Saka, anini mihecaan o pahanhanan to no kafaedetan i, minokay tayra i niyaro’ mihomong to malitengay kako ato kaka to fa’inayan, hay mafana’ to serangawan no niyah to a finacadan.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: Falo polo’ to ko mihecaan noya malitengay, nika nengneng han hato tahatenokay ho ko mihecaan nira.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: Licay han no mako cingra o no icowacowaay ko kafana’an iso a sowal, seday sa ko sowal iso to no ’Amis, mafana’ haca somowal to sowal no Ponong, Ngayngay ato Dipong.
S.TRANSL: 我問他你會哪些語言，你的阿美語說得很流利，也會說布農語、客家語和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Pangcah, as well as Bunun, Hakka and Japanese.

S.FORM: Nalicayen fana’ sato kako, nano kaemangan cingra minanam to sowal no Dipong, o Ponong ko fafahi, i katayalan nira ’aloman ko kananaman a Ngayngay, mansa kahirahira sa ko kafana’an nira to sowal.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is a Bunun, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: Ya mihomong kami i, adihay ko nisowalan noya malitengay to pakayniay i taneng no litengan a likakawa no mi’adopay.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，那位老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: Ano awa awa ko kafana’an niyam mitengil i, kaorira, luingen niyam i hawikidan a tingwa nga, nga’ay kami miliyaw a mitengil.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: Awaay ko kafanafana’an no mako to niyah to a finacadan ato serangawan, pakayni to nika o Yincomin ko tireng, ngodo sa kako.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: Matongal a matongal to ko fana’ i, mahemeken to tona o ’Amis ko tireng, o siromaay, o tadakairayan.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為阿美族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a ’Amis is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: Ano pisakalafian i, o maminokay to ko safa to fa’inayan.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: Tayra i cifa kako aci fofo mi’aca to koko’, misaday to sakalafi no safa to fa’inayan.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: Mita’elif kami to pi’acaan to dateng, adihay ko kangdaway a dateng toya pi’acaan.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kami to incay, koreto ato saytaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: Oya katihiay o paliwalay to losay a tawki, sowal sa, “koesanay ko onglay ato lopas ako. Mi’aca to miming makena!” saan.
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: Mi’aca to kami to onglay ato lopas.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: Mita’elif to kami toya paliwalay to koko’, sowal sa koya tawki, “O maan ko ’a’acaen iso? Ta’angayay a masoesoay ko koko’ anini, tolo so’ot ko cecay a koko’.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: ’Atekaken ci fofo, sakaemeden ko ’aca mamaanay han nira ko tawki a milicay.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: Kaemeday to ko ’aca saan ko sowal no tawki, cowa to kanga’ay a lowanen.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: Oya fiyaw i katihi a tawki sowal sa, katayni mi’aca to foting ako, kaemeday a ta’angayay ko foting ako saan.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: Ikor to, o koko’ o foting ko ma’acaay niyam, tahaloma’ mitangtang tomes sa ko dateng i cokowi.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: Halafinay ko pitatala, to’eman to ko romi’ad.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: Ira to ko tingwa no safa to fa’inayan, sowal sa, safana’ sanay ko sowal no sofitay, cowa kanga’ay a pahanhan sa, liyaw no pa’aliwacan nga, nga’ayay pahanhan a minokay.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: Adihay ko mitangtangan, pohayen ko salawinawina malacafay a komaen, sa ci fofo!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: Tahidangen to niyam ko salawinawina ato widawidang, malacafay a komaen tona sakadofah sanay a sakalafi.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: Ira ko cecay a widang ako ci Kacaw, halitawal cira to losid.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Kacaw，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Kacaw, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: Mitilid i, caliwen nira ko impic, sasipasip anca o ciwming no kapot.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: Kinacecay, kinatosa, kinatolo, maolah ho pacaliw ko kapot.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: Nikaorira, ira ko tatiihay a pinangan nira, marariday micaliw i, ca sa patikol.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: Ikor to i, mapili’ to ko kapot a pacaliw ciraan to losid.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: Yo cecay a romi’ad, misalama kami talapapotal.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: I fatad no lalan, sakatoma’iaw ci Kacaw, matawal nira miala ko silikami.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Kacaw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Kacaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: Caliwen nira ko silikami no kapot, cowa kaala ako ko silikami han no kapot a pacako.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

S.FORM: Tangil sa to ci Kacaw a marawraw. Keter sa cira, mana ca pacaliwen namo kako to silikami hani?
S.TRANSL: Kacaw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙？
Kacaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: Sowal han no kapot, ca piala kiso to aalaen, ano pacaliwen ho kiso to losid i, cowa patikol.
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還。
The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: To cila to a mitilid, Pacelem ci Kacaw tahira i kongkoan, Patikolen to ni Kacaw ko kapot to nicaliwan a losid.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Kacaw很早就到學校了，Kacaw把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Kacaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: Mararaway kako han ni Kacaw ko kapot. Cowa to mamatawal ako ko losid a miala. Roma sa to, miahowiday kako to kapot to pipacaliw to losid.
S.TRANSL: kacaw向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
kacaw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: O mi’adopay ko wama ako i niyaro’.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: Yo kaemang ho kako, dadaya mahadakay ca ama ato faki, o fonos ato kowang ko nihawikidan naira.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: Tadengal to ko romi’ad i, hawikiden to naira ko tama’ a minokay.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: Anca o fafoy, anca o lawal, latek iraay ko tolok.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: Sakilacen nangara ko tama’ i sacomodan no niyaro’. Palilamen nangara ko finawlan.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: Miaocil kako ci amaan, mitoor ci amaan a mi’adop.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Ta’angay to kako nga, hakelongen nira kako a mi’adop, san ci ama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: Mafana’ay ko fa’inayan no niyaro’ a patalakal, misanga’ cangra to wa’il a sapitalakal, ato sa’enec a sapitalakal.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: Mafana’ay misanga’ ko wama a to wa’il a sapitalakal. Sowal sa ko wama, o sapitalakal to tolok koni sa. Songila’en a mitapal ko naripa’an no ’a’adopen, patelien i lalan no ’a’adopen.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: Sapitooraw to malitengay a mi’adop, misaromi’ami’ad kako a minanam misanga’ to sapitalakal. Nga, kaliki matalakal ko ’a’adopen.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: Ma’araw no wama i, o aidahi kiso a mi’adop ano ta’angay to, han nira kako.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: Ta’angayay to kako no hatini. Ca’elayen ako ko sapana’ ato pana’ ako, mahakelong to wama a mi’adop.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Minokay tahira i niyaro’ i, palilamen ko finawlan to tama’.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: Sowal sa ko wama, o aahowiden ita ko pipalemed no liteng to sakaadihay no tama’ ita.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: Maosoyay kako talakongkoan i papacem.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: Ya malingad i, matawalay ako ko kafang.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: Awa ko cecacecay a mihawikidan ako.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: Yo mipakafana’ ko singsi i, hacafay hananay ako ko kapot a minengneng to tilid nira.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: Yo miseking i, pacaliwan no kapot kako to impic ato sasipasip.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: “Manikar a lomowad, aka to kaosoy!” han no singsi kako.
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: Si Kacaw ko tadawidang ako.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Kacaw，他也是阿美族的小孩。
My good friend's name is Kacaw, and he is also an Amis child.

S.FORM: Itira i Matang kami a mitilid.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在馬當部落讀書。
We study together in the Tafalong tribe.

S.FORM: Marariday kami a malacafay a mitengil to pipakongko no malitengay, Mafana’ay kami a misano’Amis.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說阿美語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Amis proficiently.

S.FORM: ’Kawangay a maso^soay kako, Amerekay a mangiliway ci Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Kacaw很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Kacaw is short and thin.

S.FORM: Si’icelay ci Kacaw. O kaolahan no nimanima cira.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Kacaw is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: O piontokayan no kongkoan anini, adihayay ko misadayan no kongkoan to sakalalifet.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: Malatengteng, mitenok to mali, comikay, makero ato mipana’.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: O comikayay ko milifetan ako.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: Toya comikay kako i, matoro’ay kako, powak sanay ko ’ilang nanitoros.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: Kaorira, lomowad kako, miliyaw ho a comikay.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: Tahira kako i paherekan i, mahemak ko tamdaw a maemin.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時，所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: Ano cowa kaalaala ko sakacecay a ngangan i, kaorira, mahemekay kako. Nawhan i, malaheciay ako ko kalalifet.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: Nacila, miliso’ay kako ato ama ako to faki ako.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: Madoka’ay ko oo’ no faki.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: Pasowalen nira kami, maofangay ko fadahong no loma’.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: Yo misanga’ cira to fadahong i, matefaday nanifadahong.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: Paterongen no ama ci faki to titi no kolong ato ’icep.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: Malaholoholol kako ato faki i kafoti’an, adihay ko mipainian nira a kongko.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: Yo mamiliyas kako i, ’akawangay to kako, sanengseng haca saan ci faki,
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: Pacako han ako, “Ano ma’adah to ko oo’ no faki i, katayhi ho i loma’ niyam a misalama.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: I tosa lefot tosa polo’ ira ko tosa a mihecaan, midemak ko seyfo to kayki o nga’ayay to a pakafiten ko ngangan no Yencomin i nifonsiw.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列名字的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: Mihomong kako ci Fadasan o milongcay to sefo to pipakafit to ngangan no Yencomini i nifonsiw a kapah no niyaro’ cira.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Fadas
I interviewed Fadas, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: Matatelek to kako ato mira tona pa’aliwan a mihomong ciraan.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: Toya pihomongan i, siwkayen nira kako to sakaira no ngangan nira, mipakafana’ haca to laloma’an nira, niyaro’ nira.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: Licayen ako cira, mana pacici sa cira a mifalic to ngangan, ya matelangay a mitingkian a ngangan, cowa kanga’ay haw?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: Sowal han nira kako, cowa kamoecel ko tilid no Kowaping to todong no ngangan nira. Anca i, “Fa syen sen” hananay no tao cira, saka adihay ko kalatawaan nona pipangiha’ to ngangan.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Fa Xian Sheng

S.FORM: Sowal sa ci Fadas, “O no Yencomin ko mitilidan a ngangan nga, o tadangangan no mita. O sakatatodong no finacadan ita, laloma’an ita, tireng ita ko ngangan ako. Saka, nanay ’aloman ko patikolay to niyah to a ngangan.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Fadas said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: Nacila malacafay kako ato fofo tayra i cifa a paliwal. Adihay ko mialaan ni fofo to mipalomaan nira a dateng, halo mitangtangan nira a kakaenen.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: Maolahay cangra to nipaliwalan no fofo a dateng. ’Alomanay ko mi’acaay to ’adiyamay ato tayaling. ’Aloman ko komaenay to mitangtangan nira a dateng.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: Ya mitangtangan nira a paheko ato hakhak i, ’adetay. Ira ho ko misakohawan a titi no fafoy, masolot no fangsis nira ko lafang. Alaraoraod sa a misarayaray mi’aca.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊買。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: Ya mitantang ko fofo i, mitahidang kako to tamdaw. Miowing kako, “Saheto o mipalomaan no fofo ako kona dateng, cowa kapaiyoen, halikien a mi’aca!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: Kaliki a mapaliwal ko dateng niyam. Sowal sa ko fofo, “Iraay kiso a mipadang kira.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: Pakayni tona demak, mafana’ to kako to dateng no Yencomin ato kalofana’ no kakaenen, matinako haca ko roray no mipaliwalay.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: Ma’araw ko nikaolah no fofo to no litengan a dateng, tada mairay ato malemed kako.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
